abstract: Spain's Socialist Party leader Pedro Sanchez resigns after majority of party's federal committee voted down his proposal to hold new party primaries at end of October; proposal, if passed, would likely have forced country to hold third national election because of Oct 31 deadline to form new government.
lead_paragraph: Senior party members forced Pedro Sánchez to resign as they sought to end internal divisions and break the impasse that has left Spain without an elected government.
snippet: Senior party members forced Pedro Sánchez to resign as they sought to end internal divisions and break the impasse that has left Spain without an elected government....

headline.main: Spain’s Socialists Oust Party Leader in Bid to End Deadlock
headline.print_headline: Top Socialist in Spain Is Out Amid Impasse
